message: Bob, I'm pleased to offer you a chance to be the first to own this valuable product. Given its potential, I'm initially offering it at $2,300,000. I'm confident this is a fair starting point for negotiations.
Alice, your initial offer is way above my budget. I'm interested in this product, but I can't go higher than $800,000. This is my best and final offer.

Bob, I appreciate your interest and your counteroffer. However, $800,000 significantly undervalues the true worth of this product and its potential. To find a middle ground, I'm willing to come down to $1,900,000. This is a significant concession, reflecting my eagerness to find a mutually beneficial deal.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down on your price, but $1,900,000 is still out of my range. I'm willing to go up to $1,200,000. This is a fair compromise, and I believe it's a good deal for both of us.

Bob, I appreciate you moving closer to a feasible price point.  While $1,200,000 isn't ideal, I'm willing to consider offers closer to $1,600,000. I believe this reflects the product's true value and offers a fair deal for both of us.

Alice, I understand you're trying to get the best price, but $1,600,000 is still beyond what I can reasonably afford.  I'm firm on my previous offer of $1,200,000.  If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to look at other options.
